name: Seneca Trial
description: Stoic evening reflection based on Seneca's nightly practice

phases.name: Prosecution
phases.prompt: Where did you fall short today? What actions did not align with your values?
phases.voice_prompt: Let's begin your trial. The prosecution speaks first. Where did you fall short today?
phases.follow_up: What led to this? Be honest with yourself.

phases.name: Judgment
phases.prompt: What's the truth of your actions? Neither condemn nor excuse.
phases.voice_prompt: Now the judgment. What is the truth of your actions today? Neither condemn nor excuse yourself.
phases.follow_up: What would the Lethal Gentleman do differently?

phases.name: Advocacy
phases.prompt: What did you do well? Where did you show up as the man you want to be?
phases.voice_prompt: The advocacy. What did you do well today? Where did you show up as the man you want to be?

phases.name: Tomorrow
phases.prompt: What are your intentions for tomorrow? What one thing will you focus on?
phases.voice_prompt: Looking ahead. What is your one intention for tomorrow?
phases.follow_up: Be specific. A vague intention is no intention.

phases.name: Memento Mori
phases.prompt: Remember you will die. Did you live today as if it could be your last?
phases.voice_prompt: Memento mori. Remember, you will die. Did you live today as if it could be your last?

full.closing: Your trial is complete. Rest well. Tomorrow, we begin again.

phases.name: Brief Review
phases.prompt: One thing you did well, one thing to improve.
phases.voice_prompt: Quick reflection. One thing you did well today, and one thing to improve.

phases.name: Tomorrow
phases.voice_prompt: What is your one focus for tomorrow?
